original: bya ba dang sbyong ba dang gnyi ga rgyud kyi theg pa'i don bstan pas de'i snod du gyur pa rnams kyis lam de'i 'bras bu mngon du gyur par mdzad pa de las kyang dpag pas gsang ba'i go 'phang chen po'i 'bras bu la dgod pa'i phrin las mdzad
analyzed: bya ba dang sbyong ba dang gnyi ga rgyud kyi theg pa'i don bstan pas de'i snod du gyur pa rnams kyis lam de'i 'bras bu mngon du gyur par mdzad pa de las kyang dpag pas gsang ba'i go 'phang chen po'i 'bras bu la dgod pa'i phrin las mdzad
translated: Even from that, he has performed the deeds of establishing them in the result of the great stage of the secret, by means of the incomparable, which is the result of the practice of each one's own action.

original: pa'o // de ltar so so nas rang gi las kyis sgrub pa'i 'bras bu las dpag pas zla med pa sangs rgyas kyis thob par mdzad pa'i don dang phrin las su ldan pas sangs rgyas kyi sangs rgyas zhes bya ste /
analyzed: pa'o // de ltar so so nas rang gi las kyis sgrub pa'i 'bras bu las dpag pas zla med pa sangs rgyas kyis thob par mdzad pa'i don dang phrin las su ldan pas sangs rgyas kyi sangs rgyas zhes bya ste /
translated: Thus, he is called the Buddha of the Buddhas, because he has the meaning and deeds of causing the attainment of the incomparable Buddhahood, the result of the practice of each one's own action.

original: de'i gong nas sangs rgyas kyi ming 'thob pa gang yang med par bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de'i gong nas sangs rgyas kyi ming 'thob pa gang yang med par bstan pa'o //
translated: This teaches that there is no other Buddhahood to be attained above that.

original: de lta bu'i phrin las phun sum tshogs pa mnga' ba de la phyag 'tshal lo zhes bshad /
analyzed: de lta bu'i phrin las phun sum tshogs pa mnga' ba de la phyag 'tshal lo zhes bshad /
translated: I pay homage to him who has such perfect enlightened activity.

original: ston pa byang chub sems rdo rje la de lta bu'i thun mong dang zab mo'i don dang ye shes dang phrin las mnga' ba'i sgo nas bstod nas /
analyzed: ston pa byang chub sems rdo rje la de lta bu'i thun mong dang zab mo'i don dang ye shes dang phrin las mnga' ba'i sgo nas bstod nas /
translated: Having thus praised the teacher Bodhisattva Vajra in terms of his possession of such common and profound meaning, exalted wisdom, and enlightened activity,

original: da ni dkyil 'khor gsum gyis bsdus pa'i lha rnams la bstod pa bstan pa'i phyir na /
analyzed: da ni dkyil 'khor gsum gyis bsdus pa'i lha rnams la bstod pa bstan pa'i phyir na /
translated: now, in order to demonstrate praise to the deities included within the three mandalas,üîΩit is said:üîΩI pay homage to those great victors who are like bodhicitta,üîΩwho are form, feeling, perception, and mental formation,üîΩwho are consciousness, the six sense bases, and the six sense faculties,

original: gang dag gzugs dang tshor ba 'du shes 'du byed bcas pa dang // rnam par shes pa dang ni skye mched drug dang dbang po drug / sa dang chu dang med dang rlung dang nam mkha' dag / byang chub sems dang 'dra ba'i rgyal chen de la phyag 'tshal lo //üîΩzhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gang dag gzugs dang tshor ba 'du shes 'du byed bcas pa dang // rnam par shes pa dang ni skye mched drug dang dbang po drug / sa dang chu dang med dang rlung dang nam mkha' dag / byang chub sems dang 'dra ba'i rgyal chen de la phyag 'tshal lo //üîΩzhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: who are earth, water, fire, wind, and space.

original: rgyu'i dus na gang zag tu gyur pa gang zhig / gzugs kyi phung po'i rgyu'i gzugs bzhi dang / 'bras bu'i gzugs bcu gcig so sor ma phye zhing @157a * //
analyzed: rgyu'i dus na gang zag tu gyur pa gang zhig / gzugs kyi phung po'i rgyu'i gzugs bzhi dang / 'bras bu'i gzugs bcu gcig so sor ma phye zhing @157a * //
translated: At the time of the cause, the person, without distinguishing the four forms that are the causes of the form aggregate and the eleven forms that are the results, is subsumed into a single entity.üîΩWhen that is purified in its place, it is buddhahood in the nature of Vairocana.

original: dbyer med pa gcig gi ngo bor bsdus pa gnas su dag pa rnam par snang mdzad kyi rang bzhin du sangs rgyas pa dang / tshor ba bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / btang snyoms gsum so sor ma phye zhing gcig gi ngo bor bsdus nas /
analyzed: dbyer med pa gcig gi ngo bor bsdus pa gnas su dag pa rnam par snang mdzad kyi rang bzhin du sangs rgyas pa dang / tshor ba bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / btang snyoms gsum so sor ma phye zhing gcig gi ngo bor bsdus nas /
translated: The aggregate of feeling, without distinguishing the three‚Äîpleasant, painful, and neutral‚Äîis subsumed into a single entity.üîΩWhen that is purified in its place, it is buddhahood in the nature of Ratnasa·πÉbhava.üîΩThe aggregate of discrimination, without distinguishing the small, great, and immeasurable, is subsumed into a single entity.

original: gnas su dag pa'i rin chen 'byung ldan gyi rang bzhin du sangs rgyas pa dang / 'du shes kyi phung po rgya chung ba dang / rgya che ba dang tshad med pa so sor ma phye zhing gcig gi ngo bor bsdus pa gnas su dag pa snang ba mtha' yas kyi rang bzhin du sangs rgyas pa dang /
analyzed: gnas su dag pa'i rin chen 'byung ldan gyi rang bzhin du sangs rgyas pa dang / 'du shes kyi phung po rgya chung ba dang / rgya che ba dang tshad med pa so sor ma phye zhing gcig gi ngo bor bsdus pa gnas su dag pa snang ba mtha' yas kyi rang bzhin du sangs rgyas pa dang /
translated: When that is purified in its place, it is buddhahood in the nature of AmitƒÅbha.

original: 'du byed kyi phung po sems las byung ba'i 'du byed lnga bcu rtsa gcig dang ; sems dang mi ldan pa'i 'du byed bcu bzhi so sor ma phye zhing dbyer med pa gcig gi ngo bor bsdus pa gnas su dag pa gdon mi za bar 'grub pa'i rang bzhin du sangs rgyas pa dang /
analyzed: 'du byed kyi phung po sems las byung ba'i 'du byed lnga bcu rtsa gcig dang ; sems dang mi ldan pa'i 'du byed bcu bzhi so sor ma phye zhing dbyer med pa gcig gi ngo bor bsdus pa gnas su dag pa gdon mi za bar 'grub pa'i rang bzhin du sangs rgyas pa dang /
translated: The aggregate of formation, which is not differentiated into the fifty one mental formations and the fourteen non mental formations, but is subsumed in the single essence of the indivisible, is awakened as the nature of the accomplishment of the pure place.

original: rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin phung po tshogs brgyad so sor ma phye zhing dbyer med pa gcig gi ngo bor bsdus pa mi bskyod pa'i rang bzhin du sangs rgyas pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin phung po tshogs brgyad so sor ma phye zhing dbyer med pa gcig gi ngo bor bsdus pa mi bskyod pa'i rang bzhin du sangs rgyas pa ste /
translated: The nature of consciousness, which is not differentiated into the eight groups of consciousness, but is subsumed in the single essence of the indivisible, is awakened as the nature of Akshobhya.

original: gtso bo sangs rgyas rnam pa lnga dang / de bzhin du yul phyi'i skye mched gzugs la sogs pa rnam pa drug gnas su dag pa /
analyzed: gtso bo sangs rgyas rnam pa lnga dang / de bzhin du yul phyi'i skye mched gzugs la sogs pa rnam pa drug gnas su dag pa /
translated: Thus, the five principal buddhas and the six objects of the outer sense sources, such as form, are the pure places.

original: gzugs kyi rdo rje ma la sogs pa lha mo drug tu sangs rgyas dang / nang gi dbang po drug gnas su dag pa'i sa'i snying po la sogs pa byang chub sems dpa' drug tu sangs rgyas pa dang / gzugs kyi phung po'i cha shas las phye ba phyi nang gsang ba gsum gyis bsdus pa dang /
analyzed: gzugs kyi rdo rje ma la sogs pa lha mo drug tu sangs rgyas dang / nang gi dbang po drug gnas su dag pa'i sa'i snying po la sogs pa byang chub sems dpa' drug tu sangs rgyas pa dang / gzugs kyi phung po'i cha shas las phye ba phyi nang gsang ba gsum gyis bsdus pa dang /
translated: The six goddesses such as Rupavajra are enlightened as the buddhas, and the six bodhisattvas such as Kshitigarbha are enlightened as the six inner sense organs.

original: sa dang chu dang me dang rlung dang bzhi de la nam mkha' bsnan pa dang lnga gnas su dag pa /üîΩsangs rgyas spyan la sogs pa /
analyzed: sa dang chu dang me dang rlung dang bzhi de la nam mkha' bsnan pa dang lnga gnas su dag pa / sangs rgyas spyan la sogs pa /
translated: The four elements of earth, water, fire, and air, and the fifth, space, are purified in their own place.üîΩThe five mothers such as Lochana are enlightened as the nature of the five mothers.

original: yum lnga'i rang bzhin du sangs rgyas pa de dag kyang byang chub sems rdo rje nyid dang 'dra bar sku gsung thugs zab cing rgya che ba'i bdag nyid du bzhugs pa ste /
analyzed: yum lnga'i rang bzhin du sangs rgyas pa de dag kyang byang chub sems rdo rje nyid dang 'dra bar sku gsung thugs zab cing rgya che ba'i bdag nyid du bzhugs pa ste /
translated: All of these are similar to the bodhisattva Vajra Mind, abiding as the profound and vast nature of enlightened body, speech, and mind.

original: de lta bu'i don dang ldan pa de la gong ma lta bu'i tshul du phyag 'tshal lo zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bu'i don dang ldan pa de la gong ma lta bu'i tshul du phyag 'tshal lo zhes bya'o //
translated: To that one who possesses such meaning, I pay homage in the manner described above.

original: da ni sku'i cha shas las phye ba sku gsung thugs rdo rje rnam pa gsum dang ye shes sems dpar bcas pa la phyag 'tshal bar bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni sku'i cha shas las phye ba sku gsung thugs rdo rje rnam pa gsum dang ye shes sems dpar bcas pa la phyag 'tshal bar bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate homage to the three vajras of enlightened body, speech, and mind, which are distinguished from the parts of the enlightened body, along with the wisdom being, it is said:

original: gang dag 'dod chags zhe sdang gti mug rdo rje'i chos dang bcas //
analyzed: gang dag 'dod chags zhe sdang gti mug rdo rje'i chos dang bcas //
translated: Those who are endowed with the phenomena of vajra desire, anger, and ignorance,

original: rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad pa'i rigs pa 'byung ba yin //
analyzed: rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad pa'i rigs pa 'byung ba yin //
translated: And who are the source of the logic of constant and uninterrupted continuity,

original: rnam pa sna tshogs dga' bas dran @157b pa med pa'i dngos 'gyur ba'i //
analyzed: rnam pa sna tshogs dga' bas dran @157b pa med pa'i dngos 'gyur ba'i //
translated: The nature of which is the various kinds of bliss that are free from recollection,

original: byang chub sems 'dra rnam pa sna tshogs de dag phyag 'tshal lo //üîΩzhes gsungs te /üîΩnyon mongs pa rnam pa gsum gyi gnas dang sgor gyur ba'i sgo gsum gnas su dag pa sku gsung thugs rdo rje rnam pa gsum gyi rang bzhin du gyur ba ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems 'dra rnam pa sna tshogs de dag phyag 'tshal lo // zhes gsungs te / nyon mongs pa rnam pa gsum gyi gnas dang sgor gyur ba'i sgo gsum gnas su dag pa sku gsung thugs rdo rje rnam pa gsum gyi rang bzhin du gyur ba ste /
translated: I pay homage to those who are like the various kinds of bodhicitta.üîΩThe three doors, which are the basis and gateway of the three afflictions, are purified in their place as the nature of the three vajras of enlightened body, speech, and mind.

original: 'dod chags ngag dang bcas pa gnas su dag pa gsung gi rdo rje chos dang bcas pa bya ba'i sgras lung sems gnyis bsdus pa ste /
analyzed: 'dod chags ngag dang bcas pa gnas su dag pa gsung gi rdo rje chos dang bcas pa bya ba'i sgras lung sems gnyis bsdus pa ste /
translated: Desire and speech are purified in their place as the vajra of enlightened speech, along with the phenomena of action, which includes the two, scripture and mind.

original: sems zhe sdang dang bcas pa gnas su dag pa thugs rdo rje mi bskyod pa dang / lus gti mug dang bcas pa gnas su dag pa sku'i rdo rje rnam par snang mdzad kyi rang bzhin du grub pa ste /
analyzed: sems zhe sdang dang bcas pa gnas su dag pa thugs rdo rje mi bskyod pa dang / lus gti mug dang bcas pa gnas su dag pa sku'i rdo rje rnam par snang mdzad kyi rang bzhin du grub pa ste /
translated: The mind, with its anger, is purified in its own place as Akshobya, the vajra of mind, and the body, with its ignorance, is purified in its own place as Vairochana, the vajra of body.

original: rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad pa'i rigs pa 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni de dag gi dus rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad pa sku gsung thugs kyi rdzu 'phrul dang cho 'phrul gyi don mdzad pa ste /
analyzed: rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad pa'i rigs pa 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni de dag gi dus rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad pa sku gsung thugs kyi rdzu 'phrul dang cho 'phrul gyi don mdzad pa ste /
translated: The reason for their constant and uninterrupted occurrence is that they are the deeds performed by the body, speech, and mind, which are the magical and miraculous manifestations of the body, speech, and mind.

original: de yang skus 'dul ba'i rigs pa la ni sku gcig dang du ma'i rnam par snang ba dang / gsung gis 'dul ba'i rigs pa la ni gsung brjod pa dang brjod pa dang bcas pa dang / thugs kyis 'dul ba'i rigs pa la ni dag pa 'jig rten pa dang /
analyzed: de yang skus 'dul ba'i rigs pa la ni sku gcig dang du ma'i rnam par snang ba dang / gsung gis 'dul ba'i rigs pa la ni gsung brjod pa dang brjod pa dang bcas pa dang / thugs kyis 'dul ba'i rigs pa la ni dag pa 'jig rten pa dang /
translated: The reason for the body is that it manifests in the form of a single body or many bodies. The reason for speech is that it manifests as speech that is expressed or not expressed. The reason for the mind is that it manifests as the pure mundane mind.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa dang rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo bsam gyis mi khyab pa la snyoms par 'jug pa ston te /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa dang rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo bsam gyis mi khyab pa la snyoms par 'jug pa ston te /
translated: It shows the knowledge of all aspects, nonconceptual wisdom, and the meditative absorption of entering into the inconceivable door of samƒÅdhi.

original: de lta bu'i sku gsung thugs kyi rdzu 'phrul dang / cho 'phrul dang rnam par 'phrul ba 'byung ba'i yon tan mnga' ba yin no //
analyzed: de lta bu'i sku gsung thugs kyi rdzu 'phrul dang / cho 'phrul dang rnam par 'phrul ba 'byung ba'i yon tan mnga' ba yin no //
translated: It has the qualities of the magical power, miracles, and manifestations of such a body, speech, and mind.

original: la la na re sku gsung thugs rdo rje de dag gis dus rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par bya ba byed pa'i rigs pa dang mthun par 'gro ba 'dul ba'i thabs dang / sprul pa 'dul ba'i bdag nyid du gyur ba ste /
analyzed: la la na re sku gsung thugs rdo rje de dag gis dus rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par bya ba byed pa'i rigs pa dang mthun par 'gro ba 'dul ba'i thabs dang / sprul pa 'dul ba'i bdag nyid du gyur ba ste /
translated: Some say that those vajras of body, speech, and mind are always and uninterruptedly in accord with the principle of performing activities, the method of taming beings, and the nature of taming emanations.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: chos nyid rigs pa dang mthun pa sku gsung thugs rdo rje de dag so sor rang gi chos nyid kyis de lta bu'i nus pa ston cing 'byung ba yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: chos nyid rigs pa dang mthun pa sku gsung thugs rdo rje de dag so sor rang gi chos nyid kyis de lta bu'i nus pa ston cing 'byung ba yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: The principle of reality in accord with reason is that those vajras of body, speech, and mind individually demonstrate and arise with such power through their own intrinsic nature.

original: rnam pa sna tshogs dga' bas dran pa med pa'i dngos gyur pa //
analyzed: rnam pa sna tshogs dga' bas dran pa med pa'i dngos gyur pa //
translated: The various joys are the actualized state of non-mindfulness.

original: zhes bya ba ni ye shes sems dpa' ni bag chags bzang po la sogs pa'i gzhi'am gnas su gyur pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni ye shes sems dpa' ni bag chags bzang po la sogs pa'i gzhi'am gnas su gyur pa ste /
translated: The wisdom being is the basis or abode of good habitual tendencies and so forth.

original: phyi nang gsang ba gsum gyi mchod pa bla na yod pa dang / bla na med pas bsdus pas mchod pa dang / gti mug gu bzlas @158a * //üîΩpa la sogs pa mnyes pa'i thabs rnam pa sna tshogs bas mnyes pa bskyed na /
analyzed: phyi nang gsang ba gsum gyi mchod pa bla na yod pa dang / bla na med pas bsdus pas mchod pa dang / gti mug gu bzlas @158a * // pa la sogs pa mnyes pa'i thabs rnam pa sna tshogs bas mnyes pa bskyed na /
translated: The offerings are included in the offerings with and without attachment, and the offerings of the outer, inner and secret.üîΩIf one generates the satisfaction of the wisdom being by means of the various methods of pleasing, such as the recitation of the mantra of delusion and so forth,

original: rtog pa mi mnga' bzhin du dgyes shing dga' bar gyur pas de'i 'bras bu ni dran pa med pa'i dngos gyur pa'i zhes bya ste /
analyzed: rtog pa mi mnga' bzhin du dgyes shing dga' bar gyur pas de'i 'bras bu ni dran pa med pa'i dngos gyur pa'i zhes bya ste /
translated: then the result of that is the actualization of non-mindfulness.

original: dran pa med pa ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i rang bzhin te /
analyzed: dran pa med pa ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i rang bzhin te /
translated: Non-mindfulness is the nature of non-conceptuality.

original: dngos su na snang ba med cing mthong ba med pa'i don mngon du gyur pa 'thob pa'o //
analyzed: dngos su na snang ba med cing mthong ba med pa'i don mngon du gyur pa 'thob pa'o //
translated: In actuality, one attains the actualization of the meaning of non-appearance and non-seeing.

original: 'o na 'gro ba'i don ji ltar mdzad ce na /
analyzed: 'o na 'gro ba'i don ji ltar mdzad ce na /
translated: Well then, how does one perform the benefit of sentient beings?

original: byang chub sems 'dra zhes bya ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems 'dra zhes bya ste /
translated: It is like the mind of enlightenment.

original: byang chub sems rnam gnyis dang 'dra bar don dam par rnam par mi rtog pa stong pa nyid kyi ngang las kyang mi g-yo ba /
analyzed: byang chub sems rnam gnyis dang 'dra bar don dam par rnam par mi rtog pa stong pa nyid kyi ngang las kyang mi g-yo ba /
translated: Just like the two kinds of bodhicitta, they do not move from the state of nonconceptual emptiness in the ultimate sense,

original: yang dag pa'i kun rdzob tu mi dmigs pa'i thugs rjes g-yo bas 'gro ba 'dul cing smin par mdzad pa'i thabs rnam pa sna tshogs pa rang bzhin gyis ston cing 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i kun rdzob tu mi dmigs pa'i thugs rjes g-yo bas 'gro ba 'dul cing smin par mdzad pa'i thabs rnam pa sna tshogs pa rang bzhin gyis ston cing 'byung ba yin no //
translated: and in the correct relative truth, they move with nonreferential compassion, naturally displaying and arising with various methods to tame and ripen migrating beings.

original: de lta bu'i don dang ldan pa'i sku gsung thugs kyi rdo rje dang ye shes sems dpa' de dag la phyag 'tshal lo zhes bstan to //
analyzed: de lta bu'i don dang ldan pa'i sku gsung thugs kyi rdo rje dang ye shes sems dpa' de dag la phyag 'tshal lo zhes bstan to //
translated: I pay homage to those vajras of enlightened body, speech, and mind and to the j√±ƒÅnasattvas who possess such a meaning.üîΩNow, in order to demonstrate the praise to the ten wrathful ones, there are four places in the body and the four wrathful gatekeepers who purify the places of the ten nonvirtues, or the three wrathful ones who are the nails of enlightened body, speech, and mind.

original: da ni lus kyi gnas bzhi dang mi dge ba bcu gnas su dag pa'i sgo srung gi khro bo bzhi'am sku gsung thugs kyi gtser byas pa'i khro bo gsum la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: da ni lus kyi gnas bzhi dang mi dge ba bcu gnas su dag pa'i sgo srung gi khro bo bzhi'am sku gsung thugs kyi gtser byas pa'i khro bo gsum la sogs pa ste /
translated: Since the four places of the body are purified as the four gatekeepers, the four wrathful ones are praised.

original: khro bo bcu la bstod pa bstan pa'i phyir na /üîΩgang dag gti mug zhe sdang 'dod chags sgrib pa'i rdo rje bzhin //
analyzed: khro bo bcu la bstod pa bstan pa'i phyir na /üîΩgang dag gti mug zhe sdang 'dod chags sgrib pa'i rdo rje bzhin //
translated: Since the ten nonvirtues are purified as the ten wrathful ones, the ten wrathful ones are praised.üîΩSince the four root afflictions are purified as the four families, the four families are praised.üîΩSince the five secondary afflictions are purified as the five awarenesses, the five awarenesses are praised.üîΩSince the six transcendent states are purified as the six sages, the six sages are praised.üîΩSince the four extremes are purified as the four joys, the four joys are praised.üîΩSince the four modes of conduct are purified as the four activities, the four activities are praised.üîΩSince the four empowerments are purified as the four kƒÅyas, the four kƒÅyas are praised.üîΩSince the four maras are purified as the four joys, the four joys are praised.üîΩSince the four extremes are purified as the four joys, the four joys are praised.

original: gzung ba dang ni dga' dang de bzhin tshul dang mi g-yo dang // rgyu dang 'bras bu'i 'od gsal chos nyid byang chub sems shes pa //üîΩbyang chub sems dang 'dra ba'i rgyu chen de la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: gzung ba dang ni dga' dang de bzhin tshul dang mi g-yo dang // rgyu dang 'bras bu'i 'od gsal chos nyid byang chub sems shes pa // byang chub sems dang 'dra ba'i rgyu chen de la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: The nature of enlightenment is the enlightened mind, which is the object of apprehension, delight, and likewise, the means, the unwavering, the cause, and the clear light of the result.

original: zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes gsungs te /
translated: I pay homage to that great cause, which is similar to the enlightened mind.

original: gang dag sems las byung ba'i chos gsum po 'di dag gis ni mtho ris dang thar ba dang / gnyi ga la sgrib cing gzhan gyis gzhig cing sbang bar dka' bas rdo rje bzhin du sra zhing gcig gi ngo bor gcig dbyer med pa'i mtshan nyid can te /

original: / byang chub rdo rje bzhin brtag de dag rtag tu phyag 'tshal lo //üîΩzhes gsungs te /
analyzed: / byang chub rdo rje bzhin brtag de dag rtag tu phyag 'tshal lo //üîΩzhes gsungs te /

original: rnal 'byor pa gang yang rung ba gang zhig gis rgyud 'di la mig gis lta bar byed pa dang / lag pas glegs bam la rig par byed pa dang / rgyud ston pa'i mnga' bdag byang chub sems rdo rje'am dkyil 'khor dang / sgrub thabs kyi mnga' bdag rnal 'byor sgrub pa po'i ming tsam thos bsam /
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa gang yang rung ba gang zhig gis rgyud 'di la mig gis lta bar byed pa dang / lag pas glegs bam la rig par byed pa dang / rgyud ston pa'i mnga' bdag byang chub sems rdo rje'am dkyil 'khor dang / sgrub thabs kyi mnga' bdag rnal 'byor sgrub pa po'i ming tsam thos bsam /
translated: who hears or thinks about the mere name of the master of the tantra, Bodhisattva Vajra, or the master of the mandala and sadhana, the yogi practitioner,

original: thos nas kyang rtag par dus kun du mi brjed par yid la 'dzin par byed pa'am /
analyzed: thos nas kyang rtag par dus kun du mi brjed par yid la 'dzin par byed pa'am /
translated: and having heard it, always and at all times keeps it in mind without forgetting,üîΩor who hears or keeps in mind the mere name of the deity they wish to accomplish,

original: gnyis su na mnga' bdag sgrub pa po'i zhal nas rgyud 'di'am gang sgrub par 'dod pa'i lha'i ming tsam thos pa'am thos nas kyang 'dzin par byed pa dang / rgyud 'di'i don tshang bar klog ma nus na yang phyogs 'ga' tsam yang klog pa yod na de la yang byang chub sems rdo rje dang 'dra bar blta zhing brtags te /
analyzed: gnyis su na mnga' bdag sgrub pa po'i zhal nas rgyud 'di'am gang sgrub par 'dod pa'i lha'i ming tsam thos pa'am thos nas kyang 'dzin par byed pa dang / rgyud 'di'i don tshang bar klog ma nus na yang phyogs 'ga' tsam yang klog pa yod na de la yang byang chub sems rdo rje dang 'dra bar blta zhing brtags te /
translated: even if unable to read the entire meaning of this tantra, if they read even a few passages, they should be regarded and considered as being like Bodhisattva Vajra.

original: de dag la rtag tu phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: de dag la rtag tu phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Always pay homage to them.

original: zhes bstan to //
analyzed: zhes bstan to //
translated: Thus it is taught.üîΩNow, in order to teach the qualities of such praise,

original: da ni de ltar bstod pa de'i yon tan bstan pa'i phyir na /üîΩbstod tshigs bzhi pa 'di yis ni //
analyzed: da ni de ltar bstod pa de'i yon tan bstan pa'i phyir na / bstod tshigs bzhi pa 'di yis ni //
translated: it is said:üîΩBy praising all the guides

original: 'dren pa po kun bstod pa yis //
analyzed: 'dren pa po kun bstod pa yis //
translated: with these four verses of praise,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' che //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' che //
translated: the bodhisattvas, the great beings,

original: mgon po de dag yi rang ngo //üîΩzhes gsungs te /
analyzed: mgon po de dag yi rang ngo // zhes gsungs te /
translated: the protectors, rejoice.

original: de ltar bstod pa'i tshig 'di rnams ni 'gal bar 'gyur ba'i nyes pa'i skyon nye bar zhi ba yin te /
analyzed: de ltar bstod pa'i tshig 'di rnams ni 'gal bar 'gyur ba'i nyes pa'i skyon nye bar zhi ba yin te /
translated: These words of praise are free from the fault of the error of contradiction.

original: des 'khor ba dang ngan song nas 'gro bas thams cad 'dren par byed pa po rgyud 'chad pa'i ston pa dang / de'i yul gyi lus kyi spyod yul dbang po dang rnam par shes pa dang yul la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor gsum gyi lhar snang ba'i sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' la sogs pa dang /
analyzed: des 'khor ba dang ngan song nas 'gro bas thams cad 'dren par byed pa po rgyud 'chad pa'i ston pa dang / de'i yul gyi lus kyi spyod yul dbang po dang rnam par shes pa dang yul la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor gsum gyi lhar snang ba'i sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' la sogs pa dang /
translated: Since they lead all beings from cyclic existence and the lower realms, they are the guides who interrupt the continuum of the teacher and the appearance of the buddhas, bodhisattvas, and so on, as the deities of the three ma·πá·∏çalas of the field of the body, the sense organs and consciousnesses, and the objects and so on.

original: rgyud sgrub cing dang du lan pa'i gang zag sgrub pa po rnams la bstod pa des ni rgyu pha rol tu phyin pa las 'bras bu ye shes las skyes pa dang / gsang ba chen po'i las skyes pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams dang mgon po bstod pa'i @160b gnas su gyur pa de dag mnyes shing dgyes te yi rang la 'khor du 'khor ba'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sangs rgyas ji snyed
analyzed: rgyud sgrub cing dang du lan pa'i gang zag sgrub pa po rnams la bstod pa des ni rgyu pha rol tu phyin pa las 'bras bu ye shes las skyes pa dang / gsang ba chen po'i las skyes pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams dang mgon po bstod pa'i @160b gnas su gyur pa de dag mnyes shing dgyes te yi rang la 'khor du 'khor ba'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sangs rgyas ji snyed
translated: The praise to the practitioners, the individuals who practice and delight in the tantra, is the praise to the bodhisattvas, the great beings born from the result of gnosis born from the cause of the perfections and born from the great secret, who are the objects of praise of the protector.

original: pa thams cad ni rjes su yi rang bar gyur to //
analyzed: pa thams cad ni rjes su yi rang bar gyur to //
translated: Those who delight and rejoice in the retinue of bodhisattvas, the great beings, are the bodhisattvas, the great beings, who rejoice in all the buddhas.

original: rgol pa pa na re /
analyzed: rgol pa pa na re /
translated: The opponent says:

original: lha dang sgrub pa po la bstod par byed kyi rgyud nyid la bstod pa mi byed pa ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: lha dang sgrub pa po la bstod par byed kyi rgyud nyid la bstod pa mi byed pa ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is the tantra itself not praised, but praise is made to the deities and practitioners?

original: smras pa / rgyud kyis kyang lha mtshon par byed pa la lha'i dkyil 'khor rang bzhin nyid kyi rnam par snang bas gcig gi rang bzhin du gcig dbyer med par gnas pa'i phyir na lha la bstod pa nyid kyis rgyud la bstod pa yin par 'gyur la gnyis su na rgyud
analyzed: smras pa / rgyud kyis kyang lha mtshon par byed pa la lha'i dkyil 'khor rang bzhin nyid kyi rnam par snang bas gcig gi rang bzhin du gcig dbyer med par gnas pa'i phyir na lha la bstod pa nyid kyis rgyud la bstod pa yin par 'gyur la gnyis su na rgyud
translated: Since the tantra also illustrates the deity, the deity mandala appears as the nature itself, and since they abide as one nature, inseparable, the praise of the deity is also a praise of the tantra.

original: bsgrub cing dang du len pa'i sgrub pa po rnams la bstod pa nyid rgyud kyi yon tan brjod cing bstod pa yin no //
analyzed: bsgrub cing dang du len pa'i sgrub pa po rnams la bstod pa nyid rgyud kyi yon tan brjod cing bstod pa yin no //
translated: In another way, the praise of the practitioners who accomplish and accept the tantra is also an expression of the qualities of the tantra and a praise of the tantra.

original: gsum du na /
analyzed: gsum du na /
translated: In a third way,

original: legs par gsungs pa'i rgyud 'di ni //
analyzed: legs par gsungs pa'i rgyud 'di ni //
translated: this well-spoken tantra

original: thabs dang rgyud kyi bdag po mchog / de bzhin gshegs pa kun gyi gsang //
analyzed: thabs dang rgyud kyi bdag po mchog / de bzhin gshegs pa kun gyi gsang //
translated: is the supreme method and lord of tantras, the secret of all tathƒÅgatas,

original: gsang ba 'dus pa las byung ngo //
analyzed: gsang ba 'dus pa las byung ngo //
translated: arisen from the GuhyasamƒÅja.

original: zhas gsungs pa nyid kyang rgyud kyi don la bstod pa yin par gzung ste /
analyzed: zhas gsungs pa nyid kyang rgyud kyi don la bstod pa yin par gzung ste /
translated: This statement itself is also to be understood as a praise of the meaning of the tantra.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas dpal gyis mgur nas legs par gsungs pa'i gsang ba 'dus pa'i rgyud 'di ni rgyud thams cad kyi bdag po'am rgyal po lta bu bas mchog tu gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas dpal gyis mgur nas legs par gsungs pa'i gsang ba 'dus pa'i rgyud 'di ni rgyud thams cad kyi bdag po'am rgyal po lta bu bas mchog tu gyur ba'o //
translated: This Guhyasamaja Tantra, which the Tathagata has excellently taught from his throat, is the lord or king of all tantras, and is therefore supreme.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: phyogs bcu dus gsum gyi de bzhin gshegs pa ma lus pa kun gyi sku gsung thugs kyi gsang ba thams cad kyang gsang ba 'dus pa'i rgyud 'di las 'byung zhing 'thob pa yin pa'i phyir na bdag po dang mchog ces bya'o //
analyzed: phyogs bcu dus gsum gyi de bzhin gshegs pa ma lus pa kun gyi sku gsung thugs kyi gsang ba thams cad kyang gsang ba 'dus pa'i rgyud 'di las 'byung zhing 'thob pa yin pa'i phyir na bdag po dang mchog ces bya'o //
translated: Because all the secrets of the body, speech and mind of all the Tathagatas of the three times and the ten directions are found in this Guhyasamaja Tantra, and are obtained from it. Therefore, it is called the lord and the supreme.

original: de nas 'khor gyi de bzhin gshegs pa rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa til gyi gang bu lta bus nam mkha'i khams yongs su gang bar gyur te /
analyzed: de nas 'khor gyi de bzhin gshegs pa rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa til gyi gang bu lta bus nam mkha'i khams yongs su gang bar gyur te /
translated: Then, the Tathagatas of the retinue, Vairochana and so forth, as numerous as the seeds in an unpopped pod of popcorn, completely filled the realm of space.

original: bzhugs pa de dag thams cad dang dam tshig rdo rje dang byams pa la sogs pa 'khor gyi byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po brjod kyis mi lang ba'i yang brjod kyis mi lang ba'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi rdul phra mo dang mnyam pa de dag
analyzed: bzhugs pa de dag thams cad dang dam tshig rdo rje dang byams pa la sogs pa 'khor gyi byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po brjod kyis mi lang ba'i yang brjod kyis mi lang ba'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi rdul phra mo dang mnyam pa de dag
translated: All of them, and the bodhisattva great beings of the retinue such as Samaya Vajra and Maitreya, who are equal in number to the atoms in an inexpressible number of inexpressible buddhafields,

original: bstod pa'i tshig 'di skad du gsungs nas rang rang gi sku gsung thugs kyi yi ge gsum la zhugs te /
analyzed: bstod pa'i tshig 'di skad du gsungs nas rang rang gi sku gsung thugs kyi yi ge gsum la zhugs te /
translated: having spoken these words of praise, entered into the three syllables of their own body, speech, and mind.

original: de yang rgyud 'chad pa'i ston pa byang chub sems rdo rje'i sku gsung thugs la byams pa'i phyir de dag so so nas nyid kyi sku gsung thugs la dmig @161a * //
analyzed: de yang rgyud 'chad pa'i ston pa byang chub sems rdo rje'i sku gsung thugs la byams pa'i phyir de dag so so nas nyid kyi sku gsung thugs la dmig @161a * //
translated: Moreover, in order to love the body, speech, and mind of the teacher Bodhisattva Vajra, who is explaining the tantra, each of them focused on their own body, speech, and mind,

original: te dbyer med par byas nas mnyam pa nyid du gyur te ci yang mi smra bar gyur to //
analyzed: te dbyer med par byas nas mnyam pa nyid du gyur te ci yang mi smra bar gyur to //
translated: making them inseparable, and became the same, becoming silent.

original: gsang ba thams cad ston pa rdo rje'i byin gyis rlabs zhes bya ba'i le'u bco brgyad pa'o zhes bya ba ni sku gsung thugs kyi gsang ba la sogs pa rang bzhin dang gab pa dang sbas pa dang mi bstan pa'i sgo nas mi rtogs pa dang mi shes
analyzed: gsang ba thams cad ston pa rdo rje'i byin gyis rlabs zhes bya ba'i le'u bco brgyad pa'o zhes bya ba ni sku gsung thugs kyi gsang ba la sogs pa rang bzhin dang gab pa dang sbas pa dang mi bstan pa'i sgo nas mi rtogs pa dang mi shes
translated: means that all that is not realized or known through the nature, concealment, secrecy, and non-teaching of the secrets of body, speech, and mind, and so on, is called all secrets.

original: pa thams cad la bya mod kyi gnas skabs 'dir ni zhus tshig lnga bcu rtsa drug po thams cad ma nor bar ston pa kho na la bya ste /
analyzed: pa thams cad la bya mod kyi gnas skabs 'dir ni zhus tshig lnga bcu rtsa drug po thams cad ma nor bar ston pa kho na la bya ste /
translated: However, in this context, it refers only to the unerring teaching of all fifty-six questions.

original: de yang rdo rje lta bu dang de mnga' ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi byin rlabs nyid de ltar snang ba yin pas rdo rje'i byin gyis rlabs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de yang rdo rje lta bu dang de mnga' ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi byin rlabs nyid de ltar snang ba yin pas rdo rje'i byin gyis rlabs zhes bya'o //
translated: Moreover, since it appears in that way through the blessing of the vajra and the tathƒÅgatas who possess it, it is called the vajra blessing.

original: le'u bco brgyad pa zhes bya ba ni mthar phyin pa'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: le'u bco brgyad pa zhes bya ba ni mthar phyin pa'i tha tshig go //
translated: The so-called eighteenth chapter means the ultimate conclusion.

original: skal ba zhes bya ba ni sgras rtog pa zhes zer te /
analyzed: skal ba zhes bya ba ni sgras rtog pa zhes zer te /
translated: The so-called fortunate one is said to be a conceptual term.

original: rgyud dang le'u gnyi ga la 'gro ba las 'dir brjod pa'i rgyud kyi don la shes par bya ste /
analyzed: rgyud dang le'u gnyi ga la 'gro ba las 'dir brjod pa'i rgyud kyi don la shes par bya ste /
translated: Both the tantra and the chapter are to be understood in terms of the meaning of the tantra that is being discussed here.

original: 'di ni rgyud thams cad kyi rgyal por gyur pas na rtog pa'i rgyal po zhes bya'o //üîΩrgyud kyi rgyal po dpal gsang ba 'dus pa'i rgyud phyi ma zhes bya ba'i le'u bco brgyad pa'i phyed kyi tshig dang don rgya cher 'grel cing rnam par bshad pa man ngag gi rgya mtsho thigs pa 'thor bas kyang gzhan dga' ba dang skrag pa skyed par byed
analyzed: 'di ni rgyud thams cad kyi rgyal por gyur pas na rtog pa'i rgyal po zhes bya'o // rgyud kyi rgyal po dpal gsang ba 'dus pa'i rgyud phyi ma zhes bya ba'i le'u bco brgyad pa'i phyed kyi tshig dang don rgya cher 'grel cing rnam par bshad pa man ngag gi rgya mtsho thigs pa 'thor bas kyang gzhan dga' ba dang skrag pa skyed par byed
translated: This is called the king of all tantras, and so it is called the king of all tantras.üîΩThis is a commentary on the second half of the eighteenth chapter of the glorious Guhyasamaja Tantra, the king of all tantras, which is called the Continuation of the Glorious Guhyasamaja Tantra. It is a commentary on the extensive words and meanings, and it is called Scattering Drops of Advice from the Ocean.

original: pa zhes bya ba /
analyzed: pa zhes bya ba /
translated: It causes delight and fear in others.

original: slob dpon bi shva na mi tras mdzad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: slob dpon bi shva na mi tras mdzad pa rdzogs so /
translated: It was composed by the master Vishvamitra.

original: // / chos nyid ji bzhin ngang las phyag rgyar sgom byed gnyer yin na //
analyzed: // / chos nyid ji bzhin ngang las phyag rgyar sgom byed gnyer yin na //
translated: If there is effort in meditating on the mudra from the state of reality just as it is,

original: gzhan la phan pa bsgrub shes dang ldan slob mas zhus ched du //
analyzed: gzhan la phan pa bsgrub shes dang ldan slob mas zhus ched du //
translated: it is for the sake of being requested by a disciple who knows how to accomplish benefit for others.

original: bdag dang slob dpon grogs blos rgyud 'grel sgrub thabs man ngag bcud //
analyzed: bdag dang slob dpon grogs blos rgyud 'grel sgrub thabs man ngag bcud //
translated: With the intention of being a friend to the master and the disciple, I have composed this commentary on the tantra, the sadhana, and the essence of advice.

original: bsdus nas gsang 'dus tshig don rgyas 'grel rnam bshad chen po bgyis //
analyzed: bsdus nas gsang 'dus tshig don rgyas 'grel rnam bshad chen po bgyis //
translated: I have condensed it and composed a great commentary, an extensive explanation of the words and meaning of the Guhyasamaja.

original: rgyud don gting phyung dkyus gtugs gshegs gsil sgor mtshams 'phel sdud sbyar //
analyzed: rgyud don gting phyung dkyus gtugs gshegs gsil sgor mtshams 'phel sdud sbyar //
translated: I have extracted the meaning of the tantra, arranged it in order, and composed a commentary that is concise and easy to understand.

original: phyi nang gsang ba mthun pa cha 'phrugs sbas phyung rgol ba bcom //
analyzed: phyi nang gsang ba mthun pa cha 'phrugs sbas phyung rgol ba bcom //
translated: I have resolved the outer, inner, and secret concordances, and have revealed the hidden and refuted objections.

original: rgyu 'bras lta spyod zung 'brel sgrub byed lam gyur go las spangs //
analyzed: rgyu 'bras lta spyod zung 'brel sgrub byed lam gyur go las spangs //
translated: I have combined cause and effect, view and conduct, and have abandoned the path of the practitioner.

original: don 'tshol 'bras bu thob 'dod rnams kyi gsal byed sgron ma bas //
analyzed: don 'tshol 'bras bu thob 'dod rnams kyi gsal byed sgron ma bas //
translated: I have composed this lamp to illuminate the path for those who seek the meaning and wish to attain the result.

original: lam 'dir 'jug mos rnams la dgos ched skyon med 'thad bsam yang //
analyzed: lam 'dir 'jug mos rnams la dgos ched skyon med 'thad bsam yang //
translated: I have considered the purpose and the faultlessness of the reasoning for those who aspire to enter this path.

original: dus mthar 'gyur blos ma rtogs sgro skur dkyil 'khor gsum la bshags //
analyzed: dus mthar 'gyur blos ma rtogs sgro skur dkyil 'khor gsum la bshags //
translated: I confess to the three circles of exaggeration and denigration, which are not understood by the mind of the degenerate age.

original: bdag gis 'bad rtsol bskyed pa'i nus mthus sems can ma lus kun //
analyzed: bdag gis 'bad rtsol bskyed pa'i nus mthus sems can ma lus kun //
translated: By the power of the effort I have exerted, may all sentient beings without exception

original: @161b sku dang ye shes bdag nyid rdo rje 'dzin pa 'grub par shog /
analyzed: @161b sku dang ye shes bdag nyid rdo rje 'dzin pa 'grub par shog /
translated: Attain the state of Vajradhara, whose nature is the kayas and wisdoms.
